titleStmt.title: Unknown and J. R. Thomas to James F. Robinson
CWG8754

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: Dear sir your will permit us to trouble you about a small affair concerning one of our constituents -- Mr F C. Jenkins was fined in the year 1861 the sum of $20000 for Permitting gaming in his house --

Jenkins is a tavern keeper and in our opinion is an orderly and good man and we think does not intend to or keep a gaming house -- And we think the one in which he was fined was accidental and contrary to his orders and from information obtained we think he now keeps an orderly House -- And would venture to Express the hope that you will comply with the prayer of the Petitioner sent to your ^Gov Magoffin^ some time ago

Pettn of F. C. Jenkins to remit fine
No ground to remit
